isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER AUTOMATE-2 - TROUBLESHOOTING (ELECTRICAL) - CONFIRMING PROPER OPERATION OF AUTO SWITCH

svcproc.title: CONFIRMING PROPER OPERATION OF AUTO SWITCH

step1.para: Disconnect the 2 pin connector at the Auto Switch. Using suitable test probes, connect an ohm meter across the two pins of the Auto Switch. Place the shift lever in neutral. The meter should read less than 20 ohms.
If resistance is greater than 20 ohms, replace the Auto Switch.
If resistance is 20 ohms or less, place the shift lever in the Auto position. Resistance should read greater than 100,000 ohms.

step2.para: If resistance is greater than 100,000 ohms, the Auto Switch is functioning properly.
If resistance is less than 100,000 ohms, replace the Auto Switch.

step1.para: Check the Controller to Transmission Wiring Harness by placing a jumper cable between the two pins of the Auto Switch connector and measuring the resistance between pins 17 and 19 of the J5 transmission computer connector. Refer to the Controller to Transmission Wiring Harness diagram.

figure.caption: Figure 226. CONTROLLER TO TRANSMISSION WIRING DIAGRAM (INTERNATIONAL ONLY)

step1.para: If resistance is less than 5 ohms, the harness is functioning properly. Proceed to the next item in the Problem-List.
If resistance is greater than 5 ohms, replace the Controller to Transmission Wiring Harness.
